definition: ossicles (in the middle ear)/also written 聽小骨|听小骨
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
smile (archaic)
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
bone
chain of ossicles (in the middle ear)

sentences.english: Lesion of ossicular chain is a common ear disease impairing the sense of hearing.
sentences.chinese: 听骨链病变是导致患者听力水平下降的普遍病症。

sentences.english: Ossiculoplasty can steadily improve hearing postoperatively in most cases.
sentences.chinese: 采用听骨成形术可以有效地改善听力。

sentences.english: Methods The ossicular reconstruction of 6 patients who suffered from middle conductive hearing loss were operated by the endoscope.
sentences.chinese: 方法用耳内镜为6例传导性耳聋患者重建听骨链。

sentences.english: To study morphologic changes of ear ossicles and auditory ossicular chain of patients with conductive deafness.
sentences.chinese: 明确传导性耳聋的听小骨及听骨链的形态学改变。

sentences.english: The technique type choice should also e pick Sichuan to the auditory bone chain operation as far as possible few methods.
sentences.chinese: 术式选择也应尽峨采川对听骨链操作尽可能少的方法。

sentences.english: Objective To explore diagnosis and therapy of traumatic ossicular chain disruption.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨外伤性听骨链中断的诊断和治疗。

sentences.english: Objective To look for an new operated method of the ossicular reconstruction.
sentences.chinese: 目的为听骨链重建术寻找一种新的手术方法。

definition: chain of ossicles (in the middle ear)
ossicles (of the middle ear)/three ossicles, acting as levers to amplify sound, namely: stapes or stirrup bone 鐙骨|镫骨, incus or anvil bone 砧骨, malleus or hammer bone 錘骨|锤骨
stapes or stirrup bone of middle ear, passing sound vibration to the inner ear
incus or anvil bone of middle ear, passing sound vibration from malleus hammer bone to stapes stirrup bone
eardrum/tympanum (of the middle ear)/tympanic membrane
inner ear
middle ear
tympanic cavity (of the middle ear)
outer ear
oval window between middle and inner ear
temporal bone/os temporale
periosteum (membrane covering bone)
internal auditory meatus (canal in temporal bone of skull housing auditory nerves)
fenestra vestibuli (of inner ear)
cochlea
malleus or hammer bone of middle ear
